MeasurementToolMetadata.Description: ADRC Uniform Data Set v3 - A1: Subject Demographics

age.Description: Age of the participant at visit

REASON.Description: Primary reason for coming to ADC

Levels.1: To participate in a research study
Levels.4: Both (to participate in a research study and to have a clinical evaluation)

Levels.2: Non-professional contact (spouse/partner, relative, friend, coworker, etc.)
Levels.4: ADC clinician, staff, or investigator referral
Levels.5: Nurse, doctor, or other health care provider
Levels.6: Other research study clinician/staff/investigator (non-ADC; e.g., ADNI, Women's Health Initiative)

LEARNED.Description: If the referral source was self-referral or a non-professional contact, how did the referral source learn of the ADC? (Blank if REFERSC no in {1, 2})

Levels.1: ADC advertisement (e.g., website, mailing, newspaper ad, community presentation)
Levels.2: News article or TV program mentioning the ADC study
Levels.3: Conference or community event (e.g., community memory walk)
Levels.4: Another organizations's media appeal or website (e.g., Alzheimer's Association, clinicaltrials.gov)

Levels.1: Primarily ADC-funded (Clinical Core, Satellite Core, or other ADC Core or project)
Levels.2: Subject is supported primarily by a non-ADC study (e.g., R01, including non-ADC grants supporting the FTLD Module participation

HISPANIC.Description: Does the subject report being of Hispanic/Latino ethnicity (i.e., having origins from a mainly Spanish-speaking Latin American country), regardless of race?

HISPOR.Description: If yes, what are the subject's reported origins? (Blank if HISPANIC ≠ 1)

RACE.Description: What does the subject report as his or her race?

Levels.4: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

RACESC.Description: What additional race does subject report?

Levels.4: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

RACETER.Description: What additional race, beyond those reported in RACE and RACESC, does subject report?

Levels.4: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

PRIMLANG.Description: What additional race, beyond those reported in RACE and RACESC, does subject report?

EDUC.Description: Subject's years of education, use the codes below to report the level achieved; if an attempted level is not completed, enter the number of years completed

LIVSITUA.Description: What is the subject's living situation?

Levels.2: Lives with one other person: a spouse or partner
Levels.3: Lives with one other person: a relative, friend, or roommate
Levels.4: Lives with caregiver who is not spouse/partner, relative, or friend
Levels.5: Lives with a group (related or not related) in a private residence
Levels.6: Lives in a group home (e.g., assisted living, nursing home, convent)

INDEP.Description: What is the subject's level of independence?

Levels.2: Requires some assistance with complex activities
Levels.3: Requires some assistance with basic activities

RESIDENC.Description: What is the subject's primary type of residence?

Levels.1: Single- or multi-family private residence (apartment, condo, house)
Levels.2: Retirement community or independent group living
Levels.3: Assisted living, adult family home, or boarding home
Levels.4: Skilled nursing facility, nursing home, hospital, or hospice

ZIP.Description: ZIP Code (first three digits) of subject's primary residence

HANDED.Description: Is the subject left- or right-handed (for example, which hand would s/he normally use to write or throw a ball)?
